The next few times we went there, I tried their special combo Pho.  The broth was tasty and you could taste it was simmered.  They use red onions instead of white onions and I think it drew out the flavor quite nice.

The iced coffee was very strong - the way I like it!  I defininitely think Pho Saigon 8 is the best Pho restaurant in Vegas.
Good pho tai bo vien & bun bo hue here, worth the money. Customer services are good.  Nothing can be compare to the foods back in oc, california. However,  this place will do.
Service is kinda impersonal. BUt the food is great. That is the reason why this place is usually packed for lunchtime. Reasonable prices.

second time coming to this location! always order a #27 with spring rolls. the pho is served fast. very delicious! 

customer service could be a little better. had to ask for extra lemons twice. 

would I come back? yeah because it's affordable.

If you're looking for authentic Vietnamese cuisine, this restaurant is perfect and it's delicious and cheap. Growing up in Westminster Ca, I never knew how spoiled I was with so many authentic Vietnamese restaurants within walking distance. After moving to the East coast, I realized not all Vietnamese restaurants are the same. I have to say this place is on par with all the pho spots back home in Ca and is one of the best pho restaurants you can find in Vegas. I typically get the pho, but also recommend trying vermicelli, the rice dishes, and egg rolls. The decor isn't wonderful but this place is really just about the food. I usually get my order to go which will consist of a container of broth, and separate container with noodles, meat, and veggies. Just heat the broth and pour it in a bow with the noodles and meat. Presentation isn't the same as eating at the restaurant but the taste is the same. Overall, this is one of my favorite pho spots in Vegas and it's definitely worth a try.

Lousy Customer service.Very slow. Gave us menus and did not come back for awhile. Not even waters for 10 minutes.Tables stink like an old dirty rag. I got the Chicken breast Pho and the broth was bland and tastless. Had to add a lot of Salt , pepper , and chil oil to give it flavor. The BBQ Pork roll was like a cold hot dog wrapped in a roll with a few veggies. They serve it with peanut sauce. Needs it to give it some taste. This was my second and last time here.

I went here for the first time yesterday with my family, and let me tell you Pho Saigon 8 has theeeeee BEST pho I've ever had in Las Vegas! Their pho broth is so tasty and it doesn't taste like water.. Unlike the other pho places I've been to. My brother isn't the biggest pho fan in the world, so he had their Korean BBQ plate & my daughter had their grilled chicken plate. Both came with a generous amount of rice, vegetables, & their nuoc cham sauce. I tried both and they were both sooo delicious! If I could order Pho, Korean BBQ, and Grilled Chicken.. I so would do it! 

Anyway, the place is nice & clean. It didn't take very long for us to get seated by the servers. The only reason why I didn't give this place five stars is because their service isn't all that great. I really appreciate servers who smile and are attentive, but you won't find that here :( I guess you can't pair up great food with great service.

Despite the whole crappy service thing, their food is on point so you'll definitely find me coming back here for more in the future :)

We were recommend to eat at this place by a local. The food rocked and was very good. Had the #1 and # 12, Eggrolls with the lettuce and herbs you dip in a great sauce and Pho soup that came in a  rich, full flavored, very tasty broth that made me think I was back in Vietnam.  Service was not the best as we were there in the end of a lunch rush but the food more then made up for that. They also let us order a 1/2 order of eggrolls when we were still hungry.

Flavor (Broth) was not the best. Cost was fine, but for a family of 5, they included an 18% tip onto the check. They also only accept cash, which didn't really matter to me, but service was so so. Been to much better.

one of the best pho places ever!  

we were in vegas last summer and really wanted some pho. so we went here and even though the place was really hot and crowded, the pho was delicious! so when we went back in december, i was afraid i was going to be let down (simply because I thought i over-hyped it to myself from the first time I went here).  BUT! i wasnt let down.  the pho was even better when its not blazing hot outside.  yum yum yum

the meat, rice plates, meatballs, noodles, etc. etc. are all great! the portion size is good for the price you pay and the place is very clean.  the service is quick and efficient.  

GO HERE IF YOURE IN VEGAS AND WANT PHO!

Best Vietnamese food in Las Vegas.  Don't have to go to California anymore.  
The Pho is phonomenal and the spring rolls are dynomite.  Ice French-pressed coffee with condensed milk will keep you high thoughout the day.  Nice Bun too.

when we saw that the noodle bar that the mandalay bay was charging upwards of $15 for a simple bowl of soup, we jumped in the car and drove a mere 10 minutes to spring valley's chinatown. 

good broth, served piping hot. good, springy noodles and fresh accompanying vegetables. and this place served cuts of beef of commendable quality in the soup. 

ca fe sua da was more potent than sweet (not necessarily a bad thing).

It's probably the best pho in Las Vegas but of course it can't compared to pho in Little Saigon. The broth is flavorful but they don't give you alot of meat. I ordered pho dac biet (special pho)for  almost $9 but there is only few pieces of meat.
My daughter lv sugarcane shrimp. Bu bo hue was nicely done.  Not too sauty. Spice d just right. The bu thit nueng rice place was a nice complement.  Will return.

BEST PHO IN TOWN PERIOD! 

I love this place for 10 years now! Rare and tendon! 
If in Chinatown this is the spot!

NOT RECOMMENDED. 
The pho was cold and they charged 15% for service without even notifying the customers!!! We didn't even know until the check came out. The ONLY thing the servers did was bring out water and our pho. NOTHING ELSE and they charged 15% for service. NEVER COMING BACK EVER!

Woke up on a Friday morning and urgently needed a pho fix.

The special combo beef pho was a no-go.
The soup was really oily along with a herbal taste.
 However, they have fresh coconut juice and perfect Vietnamese coffee !!

Um, won't be back.

My husband is a Pho addict so about once a month I put on my sweet wife hat and we get pho. We used to live in Henderson and loved Pho Saigon 8, but now that we live on the other side of town we decided to try their Spring Mountain location. 

The decor is identical to the Henderson location, but the food is not nearly as good. The dining area is huge and the wait staff were friendly and even played peek-a-boo with our little one. We ordered the egg rolls and we both decided on grilled pork vermicelli. The egg rolls were OK, but the vinegar sauce on the side was lacking in flavor. The vermicelli was a biggest disappointment of the night. The pork didn't have the usual rich grilled flavor and the vegetables looked wilted and old. I didn't touch the lettuce and scooted the limp carrots to the side of my bowl. The noodles seemed old and were cold and lifeless. The flavors were muddled, not the bright and vibrant dish I was hoping to receive. We also shared a thai tea which tasted off too. I took a couple of sips and decided I was done.  

We definitely won't be back to this location.

One of the better pho restaurants in Las Vegas.  Pho is tasty with excellent broth.  I had the BBQ pork chops and fried egg combo and really liked the flavor of the pork, however, the chop was so thinly sliced I was disappointed with the portion.  The fried fish balls and egg rolls were excellent.  Can't wait to go back and try more dishes.

Always great pho soup and usually pretty good service from the staff. Love coming here for lunch with Co workers and friends. Ordering take out for lunch is a breeze too as they package everything up neatly for you in alittle pho kit.
Tried Pho for the first time from here. Delish! So good my boyfriend stole my left overs. Really big portions which is awesome.

There must be a 1000 Pho joints in Vegas, this one is the BEST!

And they have so much more than pho: wonderful summer rolls, cold noodle bun and about another 500 wonderful menu items of fresh, excellently prepared and presented Vietnamese food. Did I say everything there is very FRESH? I hope I mentioned that everything there is very FRESH, because everything there is very FRESH:-) Wonderful food, generous portions and excellent service at very reasonable prices. What else do you want? The only folks I trust for my pho. You won't be disappointed. I promise!
Always a consistent meal over the last 14 years I have been coming here. Love the egg rolls to start and #25. Both locations consistent for me!

best pho in vegas! 

think of this place as the GOLDEN DELI of vegas! hahahah all you SGV people kno what im talking about.

this place is really good, always consistent, clean and super helpful. they dont charge you for tea (hate it when places do that) and they are super good about bringing you extra stuff like limes ect.

i come here all the time, its a little further from the strip than other places, but it is worth the drive, you will never be disapointed. I DO NOT DARE EAT PHO ANYWHERE ELSE (except maybe hue thai) lol Rice plates are good here and other noodle dishes too.

The best part about this place is that they give you complimentary hot tea. Otherwise, their broth is bland and they barely gave me any tendon pieces. Price wise they're average, about $8 for a small. Gonna keep looking for something better.

quick helpful service. the food was sooooo amazing. The broth is so delicious, meat is so soft and juicy, both the egg and rice noodles are delicious. they have more besides pho and it is all amazing!

Nothing I hate more then being serviced after people who were seated after me. Unorganized and annoying. I ordered a coffee...never got it and they still tried to charge me for it. Seriously?!!! Gave me the wrong dish...they claim it's what I ordered. Will never be back. I'll be sure to let as many people know not to dine at this so called restaurant.

This place was our every Monday and Tuesday breakfast/brunch restaurant. Since they started going late night, they have been producing horrible food. My pho had so much oil in it that taking a bite was like slathering too much lip balm on your lips!!! Had them change it out, they poured out the soup and put new soup, didn't change out the noodles! Oil sticks to the noodles!! I use to reccomend them to others but I don't want anyone to experience what I did. Some days their good, some days, like today... Their horrible!!! Still got charged for it!!

This place has really good pho.  Im def qualified to say if its bad or not. Its def high quality and  somewhat healthy. 

The owners  are great and the atmosphere is really good.  I can def say i was pleased with the service. 

Do i think the food here is good? Pho... getto bout it. I wish this place was open 
twenty pho seven

We sat down and were asked 7 times if we were ready to order. I have eaten there before so was prepared but the GF and her daughter were studying the menu and it was clear they werent readt. They felt rushed and offended.

The food was top notch and was what we expected. Im assuming they served me first as I was the oldest male at the table but they made the GF and the daughter wait 10mins for their food. 

They could have served me first and then the girls but to make them wait that long seemed out of place.

We then asked for take home boxes and the server didnt want us mixing our food. Saying that would ruin everything. 

I thought it was funny but the GF said I paid for the meal and I will do with it what I want and it freaked him out.

Outside of the cultural differences it was a good experience.

Okay, I have absolutely no problem giving this place 5 stars. The Pho is amazing! I like my soup simple. Just noodles in chicken broth. I HIGHLY recommend the Lemongrass Beef!! I believe it's #56. I'll have to update next time I'm there. 
If you're looking for some great Vietnamese food, it's here. 
Want a lot of choices on the menu? Then this is a great place. 
One of my favorite sides is the egg fried rice. It's just good. There isn't even salt on the table. The cooks know that they season their food to perfection. 
I have to be honest, I'm a little put off by the picture of the pig hanging in the kitchen. I suppose having it refrigerated would be way more comforting. 
BONUS: There is a bottle of sriracha at every table. (~: Love that.

This is the BEST pho restaurants I ever tried. I traveled nationwide to find a good pho restaurant. & this is the first time I finally found one. 

This is how EXCELLENT pho supposed to be: 
1. Large bowl with enough noodles, & enough amount of meats. 
2. Broth is correct!!!! Not diluted like the other bad pho restaurants I've tried & does not taste like Hu Tieu. The spicing is correct: I scent cowbone, star anise, and lots of ginger and roast onions in that broth; THAT'S HOW CORRECT PHO SUPPOSE TO TASTE LIKE. 
3. Your server also ask us to include a separate small plate of onions soaked in vinegar, & a small bowl of liquid fat. THAT'S ALSO HOW CORRECT & TRADITIONAL VIETNAMESE PHO SUPPOSED TO BE!!!! EXCELLENT!!!! 
4. Your Com Tam plate is also excellent. Almost to compete against Com Tam Thuan Kieu. 
5. Cha Gio (egg rolls) also good; very crispy & well spiced. 

But this is what I like most about your restaurant: 
When my buddy orders Com Tam while I order Pho Dac Biet, technically, Com Tam served a bit slow. But here, the Com Tam is served to the table at the same time with the Pho Dac Biet. EXCELLENT GUYS!!!! THAT'S HOW IT SUPPOSED TO BE!!!! All foods should come out all at once!!!! Not like other bad pho restaurants where one person receive the pho, but the one who orders the Com Tam has to wait while their buddy is finishing their plate. Overall, good service. 

So far, I have nothing bad to comment you. 

I will be back to your restaurant someday when I'm in town. I'm hoping you keep it up with the good work like you did in my last visit. 

Overall: 5/5 stars for you. Keep up the good work Pho Saigon 8 of Spring Mountain Rd.

I think this restaurant can compare to Bay Area's Vietnamese restaurant. I m not saying that Bay Area has the best restaurants but since I m from the bay area that's all I can compare. Their Soup base taste very good. I wouldn't mind going there when I visit Vegas again. Their price is not expensive at all.

Best Vietnamese restaurant in town.

I've dined in just about every location on Spring Mountain Rd., and this is the place I've been coming to for the past year or two. It is often packed with people throughout the day, even towards the late night. 

- Clean, flavorful broth. 
- Good portions for a good price.
- Great selection of food items, roughly over 100 different choices.
- Favorites are "everything-pho", Bun Bo Hue, and the Fried Spring Rolls. 
- Service is better than most for asian establishments, they are quick and attentive, but few do not speak english.
- Restaurant is clean and nicely maintained.

Overall, a great place at a great price.

Came by this place on a cold night, so I was looking for some hot pho and this was the spot my friend recommended. I was cold and starving and our server was on it! She hooked us up with hot water, instead of the cold variety and brought our food out in like 10 seconds flat! I ordered a #16, which was different cuts of beef with some soft tendon and nice noodles and broth. It was a yummy not too oily basic broth and the noodles were just the right texture. The meat didn't taste like leftover bits, which was nice and the price was just right! I think it was just under $9 which included tip! Highly recommend!!

Overpriced. And HORRIBLE customer service. Food was cold and so plain. We asked them to fix it or at least side of sauce and they refused. They said you get what you order. Don't come here. Spend the money and go somewhere else or with better service!

Heard the Pho was good so went to try it.  They do have longevity as I ate here over a decsde ago and thought i better try it agsin.  Extremely hard time ordering due to my lack of Vietnamese but that's fine my rating is based purely on taste.  Nothing special at all and far from as good as a few other of my goto Pho places.  Unfortunately not good enough to return.  Upon leaving I noticed a table that ordered egg rolls and they looked fantastic.

I recently moved to Las Vegas, and after a few bad experiences at other pho restaurants- I am happy to announce that we finally found our spot.  (We moved from LA where we made the 1 hour trek in traffic to the "Golden Deli" at least twice a month).  Pho Saigon 8 is only 15 minutes from our new home, so it already gets a star in our book.  The ambience is nice, the waiters are friendly, the restaurant is clean, prices are reasonable, it is child-friendly, and most important- the food is delicious.  

We have already come back 4 times (once a week)- and have had positive experiences every time.

Don't come to this place . Is the This get lucky cause on yelp cant have -. They have a very rude service.  and my order is missing the beef too. When I ask for a small bowl of soup. The "owner" refused it don't understand how can they still in business.

Thinking that Las Vegas has become a place for chinese people to migrate, I definitely thought Vietnamese HAS TO GOOD, indeed!

Pho was so gooood!! Thanks fellow yelpers, this is a great place!! I loved it!  We ordered the summer rolls, but I don't know why the server got confused with spring rolls... but anyway they were SO good!  Hers were SUPER fresh, mint, thai basil.  Also ordered Banx Xeo (crepe with shrimp, bean sprout and veggies i.e. carrot and turnip that has been seasoned ahead) this dish came with mint, thai basil, thai shiso (not sure if it's called like that but it does taste like japanese shiso!)

And of course the Pho was GREAT!! sweet broth, just perfect for a cold night!  It did strike me as interesting that there was no fish sauce on the table.. not that the broth needs it, but oh... well just an observation.  Many people were eating here for dinner, majority asians but some westerners as well.  The menu is HUGE, we did not get a chance to order dessert it was too much food, good food!!
